FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Spec & Gen Orders & Circ & Circ letters
Division of Cuba Vol 175 A 1900

SPECIAL ORDERS, }
No. 42. }

HEADQUARTERS DIVISION OF CUBA,
Havana, March 29, 1900.

1. Sergeant Mert J. Whitty, battery N, and Corporal
Charles E. Wood, battery H, 2d U. S. Artillery, are hereby
detailed on special duty as instructors in San José Military
Training School, Havana, Cuba.

The Subsistence Department will commute their rations,
from and including March 29, 1900, and while engaged in
the performance of the duty assigned them, at the rate of
seventy-five (75) cents per day, it being impracticable to
provide for their subsistence in any other way.

2. By authority of the Secretary of War, the following
changes and details of officers are ordered for duty in the
Customs Service of the Division:

1st Lieutenant H. C. Schumm, 2d Artillery, is relieved
from duty as Collector of Customs at Baracoa, and is as-
signed to duty as Collector of Customs at Gibara, Cuba.

2d Lieutenant J. W. Wright, 5th Infantry, is detailed
for duty as Collector of Customs at Baracoa, Cuba.

2d Lieutenant F. Van S. Chamberlain, 2d Infantry, is
detailed temporarily as Assistant to the Collector of Cus-
toms at Cienfuegos, Cuba.

1st Lieutenant LaRoy S. Upton, 2d Infantry, is relieved
from duty as Collector of Customs at Tunas de Zaza, and
is assigned to duty as Collector of Customs at Manzanillo,
Cuba, relieving Captain F. J. Irwin, 2d Cavalry. Captain
Irwin on being relieved will await further orders.

Until further orders the Chief Clerk, Customs Service at
Tunas de Zaza, will perform the duties of Collector at that
port as Acting Deputy Collector under the supervision of
the Collector of Customs at Trinidad.

1st Lieutenant W. B. Folwell, 1st Infantry, is detailed
as Deputy Collector of Customs, and will report to the
Chief of Customs Service, Havana, Cuba, for instructions
and assignment.

The officers named will join their proper stations upon
receipt of this order.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

3. Under authority of paragraph 1, General Orders No.
24, current series, Headquarters of the Army, the Subsist-
ence Department will commute the rations of Private Lewis
J. Perry, Hospital Corps, U. S. Army, now on duty in the
Medical Supply Depot, Santiago, Cuba, from and including
March 20, 1900, and while engaged in the performance of
such duty, at the rate of seventy-five (75) cents per day,
it having been and being impracticable to provide for his
subsistence in any other way.

4. Acting Assistant Surgeon Arístides Agramonte, U. S.
Army, is hereby relieved from duty at Military Hospital
No. 1, Havana, Cuba, and will report to the Chief Surgeon,
Department of Havana, for duty.
BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL WOOD:

W. V. Richards
Adjutant General.
